comments:
I am getting the following exception from my headless application.  From the exception stack, it looks like the problem is coming out from the EMF code.

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
    	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$EIterator.checkModCount(BasicEList.java:1327)
    	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$EIterator.next(BasicEList.java:1275)

Hi Jack, 

as stated in comme#5 in https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=133187, this defect  can be reproduced in following cases, are they still true?

1. It is not reproducible on slower machines or dev env

2. Using  IBM product, batch deploy, it is reprouced about once in 5 times

3. Easily  reproducible on dual core core and faster machine

The ConcurrentModificationException doesn't happen as often, but it is still happening.

The machine that I got this problem reproduced is a 2-way CPU running Linux.


Regards,
Jack
approve...   just adding lock object to ensure single threaded access during delta processing
Closing as resolved since 1.5.1.  If this bug should not be closed, please reopen.
